Articles.Content:
Just a quick question, How I do I place Rovers, Lander(s) and Bases on different planets? with out them blowing up, It would save me time for a YouTube video!

Thank you guys!

I think you can only place them in orbit around a planet you want, and just land them yourself... That's the only way i know with hyperedit... Haven't used all of its features yet cuz it's quite a mighty tool... one small mistake in using it could screw up your game.... :S

I haven't used HyperEdit a lot, but it's one powerful tool... I suggest that when you use the land function, input a value that is slightly above the current terrain height, this should stop your rovers, etc. from being destroyed due to the fact that they are spawning under the surface. Be careful with HyperEdit! It could do some serious damage to your game with one wrong move! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You have to use the land function on hyper edit and select the target location you want it on. I would recomend that you orbit first then select the land part, also select a distance like 100m, or 20m from the surface then land it your self..
